CANDIDATE 			Muhammad Aadil Makani
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:			Dewsbury
QUALIFICATIONS
L3 EAL Metrology Diploma National Physical Laboratory, London (2019-2022)
BTEC L2 Engineering Diploma – Pass Leeds City College, Leeds (2018-2019)
CAREER SUMMARY
Sept 2019 to Sept 2022 Johnsons & Johnsons DePuy Synthes, Leeds
Position: Metrology Technician Apprentice, Sep 2019 – Sep 2022
Enrolled in a 3-year apprenticeship scheme at Johnsons & Johnsons DePuy Synthes. Supporting the orthopaedic testing laboratory as a Metrology Technician.
My daily tasks include preparing the working environment, performing tests and checks on measurement tools, equipment, instrumentation, and software programs to determine suitability for use.

PERSONAL DETAILS
Location:			Dewsbury
QUALIFICATIONS
L3 EAL Metrology Diploma National Physical Laboratory, London (2019-2022)
BTEC L2 Engineering Diploma – Pass Leeds City College, Leeds (2018-2019)
CAREER SUMMARY
Sept 2019 to Sept 2022 Johnsons & Johnsons DePuy Synthes, Leeds
Position: Metrology Technician Apprentice, Sep 2019 – Sep 2022
Enrolled in a 3-year apprenticeship scheme at Johnsons & Johnsons DePuy Synthes. Supporting the orthopaedic testing laboratory as a Metrology Technician.
My daily tasks include preparing the working environment, performing tests and checks on measurement tools, equipment, instrumentation, and software programs to determine suitability for use.
Carried out verification testing on hip simulators following ISO and FDA industry standards. Involved with setting up investigational testing and have written up reports and developed new test methodologies.
Monitored non-conforming tools and equipment through data trending analysis.
Involved in verifying and validating several measuring equipment, have conducted pre/post-test measurement evaluations and dimensional analysis for research purposes.
Involved in health and safety COSHH team carrying out risk assessments logging and obsoleting chemicals carrying out routine assessments. Responsible for over 30 chemicals in the testing laboratory.
May 2019 AECOM
Position: Work Placement Student
Reviewed Computer-Aided Design (CAD) models to assess safety and effectiveness and reviewed the design aspects of manholes and sewage systems.
Reviewed and assessed the vehicle traffic flows and a variety of different embankment constructs. This involved analysing various CAD software packages to predict traffic flow.
Analysed a variety of different scenarios to assess the ecological impact.
Responsible for measuring and analysing CAD drawings, looking at tender assessments to produce estimates. Also had the responsibility of assessing a risk register and program. Involved in producing some calculations for surface water flows on new development and helped size an attenuation tank.
March to Aug 2019 Middleton Railway Trust Ltd
Position: Volunteer
Working with mainly senior engineers and students in a shopfloor environment with conventional milling and turning machines.
Was involved with painting and rebuilding the steam and diesel trains.
Carried out routine safety checks, ensuring PPE and machining tools were accounted for.
COMMENT
A confident, hardworking, and conscientious individual who has an optimistic outlook and a determination to succeed. Works well in a team environment as well as on own. A practical, hands-on learner and can learn new skills quickly to produce high standards of work. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Enjoy taking on new challenges to help develop both personally and professionally and can adapt to new situations easily, working promptly to deadlines and under challenging conditions.
Key Skills
Organisational skills
Computer skills (Microsoft Office / Minitab)
Communication skills
Problem-solving skills (Yellow-Belt Six Sigma)
Analytical skills
Time management skills
Teamworking skills
Technical Report Writing Skills
For further information please contact Julie Smith or Jan Johnston on 01695 570 696 or email julie.smith@johnston-vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
